channel.title: Apps on João's site
channel.description: Recent content in Apps on João's site

item.title: Julia Set Visualizer
item.description: Julia Mandelbrot + i Resolution: 200 var onKeyPress = function(event) { if (event.keyCode == 13) { document.getElementById('sub').click(); } } document.getElementById('real').onkeypress = onKeyPress document.getElementById('imaginary').onkeypress = onKeyPress How to use Enter an imaginary number at the fields to see the corresponding Julia set on the left canvas You can hold the Z key and point with the mouse to the Mandelbrot set, so you can see the Julia set of that point on the left canvas You can increase or decrease the resolution using the “+” and “-” buttons

item.title: Derivative Calculator
item.description: Function Variable var a = function(e) { if (e.keyCode == 13) document.getElementById('calc').click(); } document.getElementById('formInput').onkeypress = a document.getElementById('varInput').onkeypress = a .......... How to use Put the function in the first line Put the variable you want to derivate in at the second line Click on the “Calculate” button and see the derivative! Valid functions and variables Variables can be an upper or lower case letter (excluding “e”), and can have subscript using “_”, ex.
